meanings.definition: To make an object the focus of excessive or irrational devotion.
meanings.sent1: She fetishized her favorite necklace, wearing it every day.
meanings.sent2: He fetishized his lucky pen, believing it brought him good luck.
meanings.sent3: The way she fetishized her phone was comical, always carrying it around like a treasure.
meanings.sent4: His tendency to fetishize his car turned it into more than just a vehicle, but a symbol of his identity.
meanings.sent5: The artist fetishized his paintbrushes, treating them with utmost care and respect.

meanings.definition: To treat something with excessive reverence or obsession.
meanings.sent1: The fans fetishized the singer, hanging posters of him all over their rooms.
meanings.sent2: She fetishized her grandmother's recipes, following them to the letter.
meanings.sent3: His habit of fetishizing his favorite chair was endearing, always sitting in the same spot.
meanings.sent4: The author fetishized his typewriter, believing it held the key to his creativity.
meanings.sent5: The students fetishized the teacher's approval, always seeking praise for their work.
